page.title: 15Transport - the Butley Area
page.content:
In this area the transport is very poor.There is a bus which comes round in the morning, lunchtime and in the evening to bring the workers home. Most people have cars. Some people have a car sharing system to get to work or go shopping. There are also School buses which service Butley Middle, Farlingaye High and the First Schools. The nearest railway station is Melton some 6 miles away. This has only recently been re-opened. The nearest mainline station Ipswich some 15 minutes away. London is one and a half hours away.
There is a passenger Ferry at Felixtowe to go to Belgium. It usually takes 5 hours to cross but if you take the evening crossing it takes 9, because he boat goes slowly to enable you to sleep. The nearest Airport is Ipswich but it only takes Chartered Flights.
